alert.note: Alert for Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 22 at 3:31PM MDT until April 22 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southeastern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Glasscock County in western Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Andrews County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Reagan County in western Texas... Southwestern Gaines County in western Texas... Northeastern Winkler County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Northern Crane County in western Texas... Upton County in western Texas... * Until 600 PM CDT/500 PM MDT/. * At 431 PM CDT/331 PM MDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles north of Andrews to 15 miles west of Arden, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 89 and 163. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Andrews, Seminole, Kermit, Crane, Big Lake, Eunice, Jal, Rankin, Greenwood, Garden City, Stanton, Goldsmith, Lenorah, Jal Airport, Midland International Air and Space Port, Gaines County Airport, West Odessa and Reagan County Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
